alert.note: Alert for Gove (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:14PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Gove County through 945 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Gove, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Gove County. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 111 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
